Preparation: Lie flat on a bench with your eyes directly under the barbell. Plant your feet firmly on the ground, slightly wider than hip-width. Grip the bar with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, and keep your shoulder blades retracted and tight against the bench to stabilize your upper body.
Execution:
1. Lower the Bar: Unlock the bar and slowly lower it to your mid-chest, keeping your elbows at about a 45-degree angle from your torso.
2. Press Up: Push the bar back up by driving through your chest and arms until your arms are fully extended, then repeat.
Key Tips:
1. Keep Your Wrists Straight: Avoid bending your wrists back to maintain proper force transfer and avoid strain.
2. Control the Bar Path: Lower the bar in a controlled manner and keep the movement smooth to avoid injury and improve muscle engagement.

Preparation: Sit down on the machine or bench with your back flat against the pad. Grasp the handles with a firm grip or hold dumbbells at chest level with elbows bent at about 90 degrees.
Execution:
1. Press: Push the handles or dumbbells forward and upward until your arms are fully extended.
2. Return: Slowly return to the starting position under control and repeat.
Key Tips:
1. Do not lock out elbows at the top to maintain tension on the muscles.
2. Exhale as you push and inhale as you return.

Preparation: Sit on the machine with your back firmly against the pad. Adjust the handles so your arms are slightly bent and at shoulder height.
Execution:
1. Squeeze: Bring the handles together in a wide arc motion in front of your chest.
2. Return: Slowly allow your arms to return to the starting position while maintaining control.
Key Tips:
1. Focus on squeezing your chest at the peak contraction.
2. Avoid swinging or using momentum.

Equipment: Cable Machine with Bar or Rope
Preparation: Stand facing the cable machine. Grasp the bar or rope with an overhand grip and keep your elbows close to your body.
Execution:
1. Push Down: Extend your arms downward until fully straightened.
2. Return: Slowly allow the bar/rope to return to starting position.
Key Tips:
1. Avoid letting your elbows flare out.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom.

Preparation: Hold a dumbbell or cable handle with both hands behind your head. Keep your elbows pointing up.
Execution:
1. Press: Extend your arms to lift the weight overhead.
2. Lower: Bring the weight back down behind your head with control.
Key Tips:
1. Keep elbows stable and avoid flaring.
2. Maintain a strong core to prevent back strain.

Preparation: Sit with your back against the pad and hands gripping the handles beside your head.
Execution:
1. Push: Extend your arms forward.
2. Return: Slowly allow arms to come back beside your head.
Key Tips:
1. Use slow, controlled movements.
2. Do not lock elbows completely at the top.

Preparation: Sit or stand with your back straight. Hold dumbbells or machine handles at shoulder height with your palms facing forward.
Execution:
1. Press: Push the weights upward until your arms are fully extended above your head.
2. Lower: Slowly return the weights to shoulder height and repeat.
Key Tips:
1. Avoid arching your back.
2. Keep your movements controlled and steady.

Preparation: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, arms at your sides, palms facing your body.
Execution:
1. Raise: Lift the dumbbells out to the sides until they are at shoulder level.
2. Lower: Slowly bring them back to your sides.
Key Tips:
1. Do not use momentum.
2. Slight bend in elbows for joint safety.

Preparation: Stand upright holding dumbbells or a weight plate in front of your thighs with palms facing toward you.
Execution:
1. Raise: Lift the weight straight in front of you to shoulder height.
2. Lower: Slowly lower back down and repeat.
Key Tips:
1. Keep your arms straight but not locked.
2. Avoid swinging or leaning backward.

Preparation: Sit facing the machine, chest against the pad, and grasp the handles with arms slightly bent.
Execution:
1. Pull: Move your arms outward and backward in an arc.
2. Return: Slowly return to starting position.
Key Tips:
1. Focus on contracting your rear delts.
2. Avoid shrugging shoulders during the movement.

Preparation: Sit on the machine with your back against the pad. Grasp the handles or position the pads according to the machine's instructions.
Execution:
1. Crunch: Contract your abs and bring your upper body forward.
2. Return: Slowly return to the starting position.
Key Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your core.
2. Do not pull with your arms.

Preparation: Sit in the machine, securing your lower body, and grasp the handles.
Execution:
1. Rotate: Twist your torso from side to side in a controlled motion.
2. Repeat: Alternate directions for a full set.
Key Tips:
1. Move slowly for maximum core engagement.
2. Avoid jerky or fast movements.

Preparation: Sit at the machine with your knees secured. Grasp the bar with a wide overhand grip.
Execution:
1. Pull: Bring the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your torso upright.
2. Return: Slowly allow the bar to rise back to the starting position.
Key Tips:
1. Avoid leaning back excessively.
2. Focus on squeezing your lats at the bottom of the movement.

Equipment: Seated Row Machine or Cable Row
Preparation: Sit with your feet on the platform and grasp the handles with both hands.
Execution:
1. Pull: Draw the handles toward your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
2. Return: Extend your arms slowly and repeat.
Key Tips:
1. Keep your back straight throughout.
2. Avoid using momentum to pull.

Preparation: Lie on a flat bench holding a dumbbell or stand using a cable machine with arms extended overhead.
Execution:
1. Lower: Slowly bring the weight behind your head in a controlled arc.
2. Raise: Return to the starting position by engaging your lats.
Key Tips:
1. Donâ€™t let the weight go too far beyond your head.
2. Engage your core and lats throughout the motion.

Preparation: Sit back on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand and arms fully extended.
Execution:
1. Curl: Lift the weights by bending your elbows.
2. Lower: Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position.
Key Tips:
1. Keep your elbows fixed.
2. Do not swing the weights.

Preparation: Stand holding dumbbells with palms facing your torso.
Execution:
1. Curl: Bend your elbows to lift the dumbbells while keeping palms facing each other.
2. Lower: Slowly return to starting position.
Key Tips:
1. Maintain strict form.
2. Do not rock your body.

Preparation: Stand holding a barbell with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Execution:
1. Curl: Lift the bar by bending at the elbows.
2. Lower: Slowly lower it back down.
Key Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body.
2. Avoid swinging the bar.

Preparation: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell on upper back (if using).
Execution:
1. Lower: Bend your knees and hips to squat down until thighs are parallel to the floor.
2. Lift: Push through your heels to return to standing.
Key Tips:
1. Keep chest upright.
2. Do not let knees go past your toes.

Preparation: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart, holding dumbbells at your sides if desired.
Execution:
1. Step Forward: Lower your body until both knees are bent at about 90 degrees.
2. Push Back: Return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Key Tips:
1. Keep front knee aligned with the ankle.
2. Maintain an upright torso.

Preparation: Sit in the machine and place your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform.
Execution:
1. Press: Extend your legs to push the platform away.
2. Return: Slowly bend knees to return the platform toward you.
Key Tips:
1. Do not lock your knees.
2. Keep your feet flat on the platform.

Preparation: Sit on the machine with legs under the pad and adjust the backrest for proper posture.
Execution:
1. Extend: Straighten your legs to lift the pad.
2. Lower: Return to starting position.
Key Tips:
1. Control the motion.
2. Avoid jerky movements.

Preparation: Lie face down on the machine with ankles under the pads.
Execution:
1. Curl: Bend your knees to pull the pad toward your glutes.
2. Lower: Return to starting position.
Key Tips:
1. Keep hips flat on the pad.
2. Use full range of motion.

Preparation: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart, optionally holding dumbbells or on a calf raise machine.
Execution:
1. Raise: Push through the balls of your feet to lift your heels.
2. Lower: Slowly bring your heels back to the ground.
Key Tips:
1. Use full range of motion.
2. Pause at the top for better contraction.

Preparation: Wear proper running shoes and set treadmill to desired speed.
Execution:
1. Run: Begin jogging or running at your set pace.
2. Continue: Maintain speed for the desired time or distance.
Key Tips:
1. Use a slight incline for more intensity.
2. Keep a natural running posture.

Preparation: Adjust seat height and handlebar position for comfort.
Execution:
1. Pedal: Start pedaling at a comfortable pace.
2. Intensify: Adjust resistance for more challenge.
Key Tips:
1. Maintain proper posture.
2. Use intervals for variety and fat burning.

Preparation: Set treadmill to a walking speed and raise incline.
Execution:
1. Walk: Begin walking uphill.
2. Maintain: Continue for your desired time.
Key Tips:
1. Do not hold onto the rails.
2. Lean slightly forward to maintain balance.

Preparation: Get into a high plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your body forming a straight line.
Execution:
1. Lower: Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the floor.
2. Push: Press through your palms to return to starting position.
Key Tips:
1. Keep your core tight and back flat.
2. Avoid flaring your elbows out too wide.

Preparation: Grip the bar with palms facing away from you (overhand grip), hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Execution:
1. Pull: Engage your back and arms to pull your chin above the bar.
2. Lower: Slowly lower yourself back down with control.
Key Tips:
1. Avoid swinging.
2. Use full range of motion.

Preparation: Lie flat on your back with legs extended and hands by your sides or under your glutes for support.
Execution:
1. Raise: Lift your legs up together until they are vertical.
2. Lower: Slowly bring them down just above the floor and repeat.
Key Tips:
1. Keep your lower back pressed to the ground.
2. Avoid using momentum.

Preparation: Stand with feet hip-width apart and the barbell over mid-foot. Bend at the hips and knees to grip the bar.
Execution:
1. Lift: Drive through your heels and extend your hips to stand up.
2. Lower: Reverse the motion to return the bar to the floor.
Key Tips:
1. Keep your spine neutral.
2. Engage your lats and core.

Preparation: Stand on the machine and grasp the handrails lightly for balance.
Execution:
1. Climb: Begin stepping rhythmically as the machine moves.
2. Maintain: Continue climbing at a steady pace.
Key Tips:
1. Avoid leaning heavily on the rails.
2. Use your legs to push, not your arms.

Preparation: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and hands behind your head or crossed on chest.
Execution:
1. Lift: Contract your abs to lift your torso up to your thighs.
2. Lower: Slowly return to the floor.
Key Tips:
1. Avoid pulling your neck.
2. Use controlled movement.

Preparation: Lie on your back with legs extended and hands under your glutes.
Execution: 1. Kick: Raise both legs slightly off the floor and alternate kicking them up and down.
Key Tips:
1. Keep your legs straight.
2. Do not let your heels touch the ground.

Preparation: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Cross arms over your chest or place behind your head.
Execution:
1. Crunch: Lift your shoulders off the floor using your abs.
2. Lower: Return to the starting position slowly.
Key Tips:
1. Keep your lower back on the ground.
2. Avoid jerking your neck.

Preparation: Lie face down, then lift your body onto your forearms and toes, forming a straight line.
Execution:
1. Hold: Keep your core tight and body in a straight line from head to heels.
2. Maintain: Hold the position for the desired duration.
Key Tips:
1. Do not let hips sag.
2. Focus on breathing steadily.

Preparation: Stand upright with feet together and arms at your sides.
Execution:
1. Jump: Simultaneously raise arms above your head and spread your legs.
2. Return: Jump back to starting position.
Key Tips:
1. Land softly on the balls of your feet.
2. Keep a steady rhythm.

Preparation: Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet lifted slightly off the ground. Hold your hands together or grip a medicine ball, and lean back slightly to engage your core.
Execution:
1. Twist: Rotate your torso to the right, bringing your hands or the ball beside your hip.
2. Alternate: Twist to the left side in the same motion and continue alternating sides.
Key Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and core engaged.
2. Move with control to avoid using momentum.

Preparation: Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and body in a straight line.
Execution:
1. Drive: Quickly drive your right knee toward your chest.
2. Switch: Immediately switch and bring your left knee forward while extending the right leg back. Continue alternating rapidly.
Key Tips:
1. Maintain a steady pace without letting your hips rise too high.
2. Keep your shoulders stacked above your wrists for stability.
